Comments_List:
Basic use of ableton
Basics of EDM, how to make drum beats, some music theory, different instruments used in EDM

-How to use ableton
-how to read music
-how to distinguish between various instruments
Practical skills with Abelton software, history of many EDM genres, EDM analysis skills
How to listen to music and decipher what effects are being used to produce them
How to read music, measures, bpm, edm genres, harmonizations. This class was an introduction to music as well as a deeper view into a genre that is so popular.
I learned the fundamentals of painting.

Strengths: It's pretty interesting, easy workload, and a great way to get HU credit. Professor is very knowledgeable about Ableton and you can learn a lot if you pay attention
Weakness: kinda boring sometimes

Strengths:
-good introduction of ableton/working with edm
-not too fast for beginners

Weaknesses: 
-Too much time spent on history, should have more engagement with actually making EDM
-projects given did not actually teach us how to make EDM from scratch (I understand this is difficult to do during the summer, but maybe students can create only a small section of a song)
Lots of practical and fun learning. Discussion sections could have been more different from lectures.
Well-paced, helpful to students that are not as familiar to music

Yes, I would highly recommend this course--the workload is low and you do get a chance to get your feet wet. It's not fully immersive, and you don't learn how to produce EDM from scratch, but it teaches you the building blocks of Ableton Live in case you are interested in producing EDM.
Yes! Lots of fun in a low-stress environment.

Yes! It was very interesting! I had moments in which I would be scared of homework before even reading the assignment because of a lack of background but then I realized they were doable due to Dr.A's incredible job in teaching us!
